examples.translation: I used to run much faster when I was young.

examples.text: Hazır dışarı çıkmışken bir de kedi maması al.
examples.translation: Since you're out already, buy us some cat food.
Right when we were about to start the dinner, the door rang.

glosses: Assimilated form of -gan after the vowels E / İ / Ö / Ü.

examples.text: gez- (“to wander, to go about”) + -egen → gezegen (“planet”)
çekin- (“to abstain, to hesitate”) + -gen → çekingen (“shy, reserved”)

etymology: Inherited from Ottoman Turkish ـكن (-ken). Equivalent of iken (“while”).
